div1.p: Carter provides Kelly with the titles of three articles published by Henry Rose Carter that can be found in the Library of the Surgeon General of the Army.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Howard A. Kelly, November 9, 1923

opener.dateline:
Care Dr. Calvin Goddard,
529 North Wolfe St.,
Baltimore, Md.
Nov. 9, 1923.

div1.p:
There are three articles by Father on Yellow Fever at the Surgeon
General's Library, which, by rights, belong together:

The first, whose title I was too tired to remember last night,
is
“A Note on the Interval Between Infecting and Secondary Cases of
Yellow Fever” etc. The explanations of the possible reason for this
phenomenon at the end of the paper were, as I told you, omitted on
publication because it was thought that the findings would be more apt
to be accepted if they were not used to prove a point, and the main
thing at that time was to get the findings accepted. I really will
be very glad for you to see this original MSS., which, as I also told
you, is part of a “permanent loan” of Father's early work to the Li-
brary of the Surgeon General of the Army.

The 2nd. article: “The Period of Incubation of Yellow Fever” and
the 3rd. “Yellow Fever in Houses.
Extrinsic Incubation” were meant, with the
first to form a trilogy on this subject, the 2nd., of course, being the
period of incubation in man.

If at any future time, I can be of help in sending you data, I
shall consider it a privelege.

With highest expressions of esteem, in which Father would join
did he know I was writing, I remain
